info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, east central Chester, Philadelphia and northeastern Delaware Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Norriton, or 17 miles northeast of West Chester, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Norristown, Phoenixville, West Norriton, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Hatboro, Ambler, Collegeville, Jenkintown, Narberth, Trappe, Rockledge, Abington, Bryn Athyn, Morris Park, Bryn Mawr, Radnor Township and Kensington. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 323 and 345. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 29. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 19 and 24. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 350. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 11 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
